title.narrative: Cooperation programme Netherlands Court of Audit and Supreme Audit Institutions of Tanzania, Mozambique and Kenya in association with AFROSAI-E

description.narrative: Rich oil and gas fields have recently been identified in Tanzania, Mozambique and Kenia. The exploitation of these resources, and procurement and allocation of claims, are often characterized by a lack of transparency and corruption incidents, resulting in low public confidence. Supreme Audit Institutions have a vital role in improving the current situation, but are hampered by knowledge constraints. This project aims to improve the quality of performance auditing activities in the oil and gas sector through training and guidance of auditors in the respective countries. In parallel, experience and lessons are shared regionally between these countries, and on a broader scale through AFROSAI-E.

title.narrative: MAG18TZ01_00
Private Sector Development (PSD)
Number of identified opportunities for investment and/or follow-up PSD projects - Total

comment.narrative: ? AFROSAI-E should consider developing a comprehensive training programme for auditors in Extractive Industries sector ? Expand the capacity of WGEI to offer more specialized trainings in the sector ? Exchange programs for countries within the region ? Create a forum or mechanism for SAIs to initiate cooperative audits. The stakeholders should establish a mechanism whereas SAIs based on sector developments within their countries could initiate and conduct cooperative audits. For example Tanzania and Uganda have a potential of conducting an audit on the constructed oil pipeline between the countries. ? To broaden information sharing and enhance capacity building on low budget. The stakeholders should emphasize an online information sharing among the SAIs and e-learning opportunities.

title.narrative: Private Sector Development (PSD)
Number of people indirectly reached - Local

comment.narrative: This project has had an enormous global outreach, demonstrated by the participants list of the online learning module, as well as the attendence list of the closing conference. Through the communication channels of ARK and AFROSAI (and other branches), continuous attention will be drawn to the need of performance auditing in the oil and gas industries. In addition to the publication of the 6 reports, an overarching artical in INTOSAI journal is planned to be published in 2021. Repurposing the lessons learned on the technicalities of the audit process for a broader audience. The article will include a summary of the conclusions and recommendations from the parallel audit studies. This journal is read by all Supreme Audit Insitutions worldwide.

title.narrative: Private Sector Development (PSD)
Number of people directly reached - Local

comment.narrative: This refers to the attendants of the closing conference, which was organized online as an alternative to the original closing workshop which could not be hosted due to COVID-19 travel restrictions. Te objective of the conference has been to share the audit conclusions and recommendations and lessons learned from the regional project, among the partners and with other SAIs worldwide interested in conducting audits in the petroleum sector. Representatives from 47 different countries in total were present.

title.narrative: Private Sector Development (PSD)
Number of strengthened government organisations for a sustainable business climate - Total

comment.narrative: Supreme Audit Institutions of Kenia, Tanzania and Mozambique. The indirect reach of other SAIs through the learning conference and e-learning module have not been counted as supported institutions, although they will surely take notice of the findings.

title.narrative: Private Sector Development (PSD)
Number of courses/trainings developed/adopted for local dissemination - Total

comment.narrative:
The online course “how to audit government’s performance in managing oil and gas contracts” was launched in July 2020 on AFROSAI-E’s Learning Platform (ALP). Auditors from SAIs worldwide who want to increase or test their knowledge in this field can use this course for free, at their convenience. The online course is in English and has been made available in Arabic and French (September 2020) and Portuguese (June 2021).
The online course has been broadcasted to the target audience through the communication channels of AFROSAI-E, INTOSAI’s Capacity Building Committee (CBC) and the Working Group of Extractive Industries (WGEI). These dissemination partners are targeting SAIs only.

title.narrative: Private Sector Development (PSD)
Number of strengthened semi-government organisations for a sustainable business climate - Total

comment.narrative: The participating auditors highly appreciated the exchange of knowledge and the guidance in conducting a system-based performance audit in the petroleum sector. The former AGs and the newly nominated AGs all acknowledged the importance of conducting audits in the petroleum sector. During the closing conference all three auditors emphasized the importance of the lessons learned and the intention to continue working in this field strengthened by the experience and lessons gained from this project.

title.narrative: Private Sector Development (PSD)

Description of changes achieved in laws, regulations, policy plans, outcomes of social dialogue or development strategies enacted or adopted by local government or social dialogue partners, yielding tangible benefits to the business climate

comment.narrative: This project leads to the publication of 6 different audit reports (2 per country). 3 of these reports will focus on contract monitoring, the fourth on contractual obligations in contract monitoring, the fifth on environmental management in the petroleum sector and the last on inception and implementing of oil and gas mega projects. In the end, all these audits will reflect on the question whether the right procedures are in place to ensure public profit from large extractive contracts. These audits can form the basis for better laws, policies and decision making in this sector.

comment.narrative: This refers to the participants of the e-learning module originating form a developing country. Since the e-learning is integrated in AFROSAI-E's online platform, this number will increase in the years to come.
